etymology.description: 岡(冈) (gāng, "ridge") + 刀(刀) (dāo, "knife") = 岡 provides phonetic value and 刀 provides meaning related to cutting -> firm or just
etymology.interpretation: The character represents firmness or strength through the visual association with a knife, and the phonetic element 岡(冈) (gāng, "ridge") emphasizes the hard, unyielding nature of ridges.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 剛 by replacing 岡(冈) with its simplified form 冈(冈).

examples.chinese: 我刚从图书馆出来(我剛從圖書館出來)，就开始准备考试(就開始準備考試)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ gāng cóng túshūguǎn chūlái, jiù kāishǐ zhǔnbèi kǎoshì.
examples.english: I just came out of the library and started preparing for the exam.

examples.chinese: 他的回答刚正不阿(他的回答剛正不阿)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de huídá gāng zhèng bù ā.
examples.english: His answer is upright and uncompromising.

examples.chinese: 我们刚见面(我們剛見面)，就聊得很投机(就聊得很投機)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen gāng jiànmiàn, jiù liáo dé hěn tóujī.
examples.english: We just met and hit it off immediately.
